data.title: Our Grand kids love this place
data.text: Jungle Burger has great burgers and a selection of other foods as well. Fries, onion rings, you name it, they got it.

data.title: Great Burgers!
data.text: IMHO it is the best burger in Mckinney and 2nd best in DFW. Large patties cooked to order all the fixins available and great prices

data.title: Walked Out After 10 Minutes Grossed Out
data.text:
I'll start off by adding the disclaimer that I'm not the type of person to complain about places. Normally if I don't like a place I simply will not go back.  I don't feel it's necessary to bash a place if I don't like it.

However, I feel it's necessary to put a review on this place just out of concern of our 10 minute experience.

My fiancée and I decided to try Jungle Burger because of the reviews of having one of the "Best" burgers in McKinney. We walked in a right away the inside of the place wasn't all impressive. We stood waiting for somebody to seat us and just decided to seat ourselves. The first table we picked was dirty and in need of being wiped off. As we were looking a server met us. We sat at a different table and as we sat down we noticed a cricket sitting ON the table. The server didn't make any effort to remove the cricket, and it was up to my fiancée to sweep it off the table.

Right away that left me in a "should we stay or go" mindset. But we decided to stick it out as we told the server we'd take some waters. The server proceeded to tell us how when he comes in to work, he'll sweep a ton of crickets off the (front) windows. This got my mind to thinking if there are crickets on the window, where else do they go? The server left to get us our waters, brought them back and left so we could look at the menu. As we were looking I really was in the frame of mind to leave. My fiancée then told me to turn around. I turned around and there was a cricket sitting on the top of the booth just shy of my shoulder. 

That was our deciding factor to get up and leave. I don't know if the food here is good but I'm not willing to try if there are issues with bugs inside the place. I find it hard to believe this is a "one time incident" and have to think there are all sorts of health code violations.  I hope they can clean up this and still be a good place, but for me I will not go back, which is too bad because I'm all about supporting local business.

data.title: Over rated!
data.text: Eaten here often for several years. It's gone downhill in food, and costs more. Took two grandkids for lunch. $40 for three!  Soggy fries, average burgers. Definitely not worth the price.

data.title: Ok but not great and very pricey
data.text:
My wife and I had been told by our auto mechanic that this place had the best burgers in McKinney.  Well, he was wrong.  It took me over $25 (2 regular burgers, 1 small fry, and 2 small drinks) to find out.  Plus a tip was added for the server.

The burger was good, but not great.  The slender fries are cut in house, skin-on and have a spicy seasoning and, in our case, over cooked . I didn't notice if they had unseasoned fries.

The burgers are ½ pound and cooked to your request.  That part was fine except they didn't grill (as requested) my jalapeños and onions.  They were raw.

If you want to add bacon, cheese, avocado, etc. it would cost $1.00 for each addition.  In order to get my burger the way I usually do at my favorite place I would have paid over $12 for ONE burger!  That's ridiculous.

I rated it average mainly because of their prices.   I'm sure there are other burger places that are similar in price.  So If you have money to burn, then by all means go to Jungle Burgers.  If you don't, then go to the NE corner of highways 5 & 380.

I won't mention the name, just look for the location based on my indicated location.  I am not associated with that establishment, just a very happy and satisfied customer.

data.title: Delicious
data.text:
Not exactly sure what took us so long to try this place out. It's got a pretty convenient location right off 75 and never appears crowded. 

Today we took the plunge. I got a double cheeseburger which was absolutely huge. Possibly some of the largest patties I've ever had. And my gf got the chili cheese dog, which was off the chain. Awkward pun intended. But seriously though, I could have that meal every day of my life. 

Last and possibly least, we got the regular fries and the curly fries. The curly fries were great. We were a little disappointed by the regular fries. We're no fry connoisseurs but we expected the latter to be more crunchy. 

Next time we'll probably get the shakes too, as they now serve shakes. And they looked tasty.

We like this place. We'll go back, certainly.

data.title: Food ok, service awful
data.text: Great variety menu and food was good. Our burgers were hot but everyone's fries were cold. Service was awful! A different lady delivered our food and was far from friendly. Acted like we were bothering her. A person in our party asked for ranch and she replied, "I will get your server, I have to get back to to go orders". They were not busy and we watched this same lady sit down and watch tv the rest of the time we were there. We never got refills on drinks and the server was MIA. Have no clue where she was since this place is so small. Too bad the service was bad....that alone will make me never come back.

data.title: Conflicted feelings
data.text: The burgers are great. Service is quick. They have some relatively new servers who are way better than their past crew. The only negative thing I can say is that the owner or manager guy went on a long rant about how women belong in the kitchen and shouldn't be working in jobs created for men. Specifically he was discussing women news anchors. Not a fan of his personal views so I give this place a 3 out of 5

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: Me and my wife were looking where to satisfy our cravings for a great burger and we decided to give jungle burger a try. It was not disappointing at all. Great tasting burgers!!!! We will definitely will return. I order the bacon egg and cheese burger with seasoned fries and she order a bacon cheese burger with regular fries. They where big juicy burgers. The fried pickles were good also.

data.title: Good burger for a good price
data.text:
This is the go-to burger joint in McKinney for my friends and I. The burgers are great quality for their price, and the sweet potato fries are fantastic. There is plenty of seating available.

My only problem is that maybe half the time I order a burger, it comes out slightly wrong. I'm lactose intolerant, so getting cheese on my burger is a no-go. However, this isn't a problem since the staff is super friendly and always very quick to remedy the situation.

I wouldn't keep returning if I didn't think it was well worth the visit.

data.title: Great burgers etc
data.text: Went today of try Jungle Burger and was pleasantly surprised.  I have a chilli cheese burger and it was delicious.  Chili was very tasty on the burger and meat was great.  Ordered Tator Tots with it and they were cooked to a good golden brown and crunch.  Like the choices on the menu other sandwiches and salads.  Will definitely will go back soon.

data.title: Great Menu - Great Burgers
data.text: Gave this place a try on an afternoon bike ride and glad we found it. Their regular burger is very big. I ordered the bacon, egg and cheese burger w/single patty. Picture attached. It was a big burger at least two inches thick w/no veggies. The wife got a Jr burger and it was just right. We split an order of sweet potato fries and they served them with marshmallow cream sauce!! OH MY!! It was delicious. They serve all kinds of flavored tea and their menu is huge. Something for everyone. One thing to note: Mon-Thur if you buy a burger and two drinks you get a burger of equal value FREE!! Great deal!! I hope you give this place a try. They also have locations in Greenville, Sherman and Terrell.

data.title: Kills your big burger meat cravings
data.text: Great big juicy burgers with lots on them.  Best burger place in McKinney.  Try the sweet potato fries with marsh mellow crème.  Service is good and friendly.  But the burgers will kill any meat cravings you have.  Lots of other options as well.

data.title: Big Burger with Big Price
data.text: Pretty decent burger and fries but when a combo costs $11.50, I have a hard time with that. Menu selection was good with 20 burgers and also hot dogs, chicken burgers, and a few entrees. This is sit down service and our waitress was attentive.  Food came out promptly and I did enjoy the food.

data.title: Huge menu!
data.text: There are at least a dozen burgers on their 6 page menu. I had the Italian sub and my husband had the Kahuna burger. We loved it! Fast service. Friendly waitress. When our kids come for a visit we know where we are going to take them. It's our new favorite burger place!

data.title: Great lunch!
data.text: Nice place to pick up burger and chili cheese dog for lunch!  Love the sweet potato fries. Server was friendly and attentive. Would definitely eat here again when near this location.

data.title: Great little place to get a meal.
data.text: Had sweet tea that was perfect. A nice waitress who was friendly. And a great chipotle burger that was freshly made. Had so many toppings that you need a fork to clean up and a great taste. Meat was good and cook perfectly.

data.title: Great Burger joint
data.text: I stopped in for lunch. The place was packed with people but I did not have to wait to get a seat. My waitress greeted me promptly and answered menu questions that I asked. I had the Thousand Island burger combo. The burger was 1/2 pound Angus beef topped with grilled onions, lettuce, pickle, bacon and in-restaurant made Thousand Island dressing. The burger was served with fresh cut fries and drink.

data.title: Best burger in McKinney?
data.text:
The JUNGLE BURGER!  When we think of a good burger place, the Jungle Burger comes to mind. Certainly the name does not yell “great burger”, but don't judge it by name alone!

Every time we have eaten here the employees are very friendly and greet us within seconds of entering.  Our waitress was super friendly and offered great suggestions when asked.  Our food was brought to our table in about 10 minutes, very happy with speed of service.

Our burgers came out exactly as we ordered them, with my burger being a little pink on the inside - tough to do sometimes.  The burger was HUGE and the meat looked like it was hand made and not a frozen patty.  Loaded with toppings too!!  The fries were seasoned very well and there were lots of them.  The chicken fried chicken sandwich was also cooked to order, crispy on the outside and hot on the inside. The onion rings were divine, we could have made a meal out of those alone! All the delicious food for under $20!

We have not sampled all of the burger places in McKinney, but this is certainly in our top three.  This is a burger place that we would go out of our way to eat at again.  Excellent!

data.title: Really good burger
data.text: Great burger and tots.  This was my 2nd time, and prices seem a little higher, but burgers are 1/2lb and really good.   Our waiter was very attentive and tried hard toke sure we were taken care of.
